title: Chelsea vs Arsenal LIVE : Carabao Cup latest score and goal updates
body_text:
A thrilling Carabao Cup semi-final first leg finished 3-2 to Arsenal at Stamford Bridge, with Chelsea beaten but alive in the tie.
The Gunners were ahead early on as Ben White nodded in from a corner after just seven minutes, with Robert Sanchez flapping at the cross.
It got worse for the Blues keeper as he fumbled a low cross to allow Viktor Gyokeres to poke home a second just after the break.
Things looked pretty bleak for Liam Rosenior’s men at that point but they responded impressively after a spell of Arsenal pressure.
Substitute Alejandro Garnacho got Chelsea back into it with a smart finish just before the hour mark, but Martin Zubimendi’s strike re-established Arsenal’s two-goal lead.
Garnacho popped up at the back post late on, though, netting from a corner as Kepa Arrizabalaga floundered on the deck.
The second leg is played at the Emirates next month and while clearly Arsenal have the advantage, Garnacho has kept Chelsea hopes alive.
Get your football fix

From the latest transfer rumours and managerial moves to analysis of the biggest games and a lot more, our experts have you covered.
Sign up here, it's an open goal.
The Gunners thought they had a penalty late on as Gabriel Jesus was taken down by Jorrel Hato, but the Brazilian was eventually given offside.
More Trending
There were eight bookings in the match, which was largely good-spirited, but got spicy towards the end and there were handbags after the final whistle.
Rosenior, who was taking charge of his first game at Stamford Bridge, was on the field dragging captain Enzo Fernandez away from the trouble.
White sounded frustrated that Chelsea got back into the game after the break, telling Sky Sports: ‘We didn’t play very well in the second half and let them give us more pressure. Not up to our standards really, a disappointing second half.’
Hostilities will resume on Tuesday February 3 in north London.
Live Feed
This Live Blog has now ended
This blog is now closed. For the latest updates, visit Metro’s Football page.
That’s it!
Thanks for following our live coverage of a brilliant clash which finished Chelsea 2-3 Arsenal in this Carabao Cup semi-final first leg.
Full-time: Chelsea 2-3 Arsenal
That’s it. Arsenal take it 3-2 in a fantastic contest.
Deserved victory but Chelsea battled well and Garnacho capitalised well for two second half goals.
90+6 mins: Chelsea 2-3 Arsenal – Yellow card
Jurrien Timber booked for a foul on Andrey Santos
90+5 mins: Chelsea 2-3 Arsenal
The home fans seething with Chelsea knocking it about at the back deep into injury time. It does make its way up to Garnacho and then Estevao, a cross comes in but Neto can only manage a tame header.
90+4 mins: Chelsea 2-3 Arsenal
Arsenal win a penalty as Jesus is hacked down by Hato. No, he was offside, it just took the officials forever to give. Just put your flag up!
90+2 mins: Chelsea 2-3 Arsenal
Chelsea slowly playing the ball out from the back in injury time, much to their fans’ disgust.
90+1 mins: Chelsea 2-3 Arsenal
White eventually slings the ball into the box after a short free-kick but it’s easy for Sanchez. Chelsea look to break, Estevao ambitiously asks for a penalty after a coming together with Gabriel. Nope.
90 mins: Chelsea 2-3 Arsenal – Yellow card
Pedro Neto gets booked for shouting something at the ref. Andrey Santos had given away a clear free-kick for a foul on Saka. Neto was fuming for some reason.
89 mins: Chelsea 2-3 Arsenal
Kai Havertz getting loudly booed by the Chelsea fans
88 mins: Chelsea 2-3 Arsenal
Kepa under pressure again, but he does win a free-kick this time as he flaps at a cross.
83 mins: GOAL – Chelsea 2-3 Arsenal
It’s Garnacho again!
Neto’s corner eventually falls to Garnacho at the back post and he hits a good enough shot with Kepa on the deck, it goes in.
The Arsenal keeper was hoping for a foul but it is not given. He jumped with a number of players and ended on the floor, allowing Garnacho to score.
83 mins: Chelsea 1-3 Arsenal
As often when there have been so many substitutes late on, the game becomes a little disjointed. Estevao remains a constant thorn in Arsenal’s side, though, winning a corner on the right.
81 mins: Chelsea 1-3 Arsenal – Substitutes
Chelsea take off Joao Pedro and Cucurella for Tosin and Mheuka
Arsenal also making changes as Rice and Gyokeres come off for Havertz and Jesus.
79 mins: Chelsea 1-3 Arsenal
Alan Smith on Sky Sports commentary says this has been one of Estevao’s best games in a Chelsea shirt. He has certainly been their most threatening player.
78 mins: Chelsea 1-3 Arsenal – Yellow card
Poor challenge from Merino on Joao Pedro. Clearly a booking.
76 mins: Chelsea 1-3 Arsenal
What a chance for Merino and a superb save from Sanchez.
A big scrap for the ball in the Chelsea box sees it pop up to an unmarked Merino and he fires in a good shot that is brilliantly kept out.
The subsequent corner is headed into the ground by Gabriel and it bounces over. Another good chance!
76 mins: Chelsea 1-3 Arsenal – Yellow card
Arrizabalaga gets booked for time wasting.
75 mins: Chelsea 1-3 Arsenal
Hato comes on for Fofana as Rosenior mixes up his defence
74 mins: Chelsea 1-3 Arsenal
Obviously that is a hammer blow to Chelsea, who had been lively in their pursuit for an equaliser.
They have not given up though, with Estevao still bright and threatening.
71 mins: GOAL – Chelsea 1-3 Arsenal
Martin Zubimendi scored Arsenal’s third!
Great goal from the midfielder, who showed very neat feet in the Chelsea box, making space for himself before firing past Sanchez. Gyoekres laid it off for Zubimendi nicely.
